alert.note: Alert for Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of eastern New York and southern Vermont, including Rensselaer County in eastern New York and Bennington and Windham County in southern Vermont. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bennington, Hoosick Falls, Pownal, Grafton, Berlin, Wilmington, Hoosick, Pittstown, North Bennington, Woodford, Old Bennington, Searsburg, Somerset, Pownal Center, Paper Mill Village, North Pownal, South Shaftsbury, East Hoosick, Petersburg Junction and North Petersburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
